SENT.plain: Twenty patients with various angiomatous lesions of the gastrointestinal tract, such as right-colon angiodysplasia and manifestations of Rendu-Osler-Weber disease and Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome are reported
During the past 15 years an increasing number of such lesions have been reported, diagnosed mainly by angiography
The major complication from these vascular lesions is bleeding

Angiography is the primary method for their detection because of their often small size and is a prerequisite before surgery when reason exists for anticipating an angiomatous lesion as the source of bleeding
However, in certain cases angiography will fail to demonstrate the vascular abnormality or its full extent
